title: Farid Amarouche
text: Farid Amarouche is a French wheelchair athlete. He won the 1991 <a href="London%20Marathon">London Marathon</a> men's wheelchair race in a close finish, setting a new course record of 1:52:52 and beating previous and future winners <a href="Hakan%20Ericsson">Hakan Ericsson</a>, <a href="Daniel%20Wesley%20%28athlete%29">Daniel Wesley</a>, and <a href="David%20Holding">David Holding</a> in the process. He also took part in the <a href="1988%20Summer%20Paralympics">1988</a> and <a href="1992%20Summer%20Paralympics">1992 Summer Paralympics</a>, winning three gold and three silver medals in the earlier year.
